definition: cold/to shiver with cold/to tremble with fear/afraid/apprehensive/strict/stern/severe/austere/awe-inspiring/imposing/majestic
cold/to shiver with cold/to tremble with fear/afraid/apprehensive/strict/stern/severe/austere/awe-inspiring/imposing/majestic

sentences.english: Majestic bald eagles also feast on the salmon.
sentences.chinese: 威风凛凛的白头鹰也爱吃鲑鱼。

sentences.english: As Nell approached the awful door, it turned slowly upon.
sentences.chinese: 耐儿走近那威风凛凛的大门时，它正在慢慢地打开。

sentences.english: China's awe-inspiring rise is often framed as the return to a historical norm.
sentences.chinese: 中国威风凛凛的崛起经常标上回归历史正常水平。

sentences.english: They were taken in flank by a troop of cavalry.
sentences.chinese: 这支骑兵部队非常威风凛凛。

definition: to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
variant of 氣宇軒昂|气宇轩昂[qi4 yu3 xuan1 ang2]
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
(of a person) valiant and formidable-looking/to carry oneself tall
to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
